page.title: 13CELEBRATIONS
page.content: For the Chinese and some of the Vietnamese February is the time of the year for celebrations as their New Year falls at this time. The celebrations usually begin on the 13th day of the month when the family gather for a special meal, the visiting of friends and relatives and the exchanging of gifts of money, food and other presents normally occurs. Children often receive their presents in the form of money in red envelopes. For Hindus the time of celebration is September or early October when the hall of a local school is given over to music and dancing around a central display that depicts religious events. It lasts from early evening till midnight. 10 days of celebrating take place with all the family involved. Shoes have to be taken off before entering the hall.
